snippet: The Transportation Safety Board of Canada cited 18 factors for the derailment and explosion of a train carrying Bakken crude oil that killed 47 people in Lac Mégantic, Quebec.
abstract: Transportation Safety Board of Canada releases report highlighting lax oversight that it says led to derailment of runaway train carrying Bakken crude oil, resulting in deaths of 47 people and destruction of much of Lac Megantic, Quebec, in 2013; says that railway operator blatantly disregarded safety rules and that its employees were inadequately trained.
lead_paragraph: The Transportation Safety Board of Canada cited 18 factors for the derailment and explosion of a train carrying Bakken crude oil that killed 47 people in Lac Mégantic, Quebec.

headline.main: Report Faults Transport Canada in Fatal Train Derailment
headline.print_headline: Report Faults Canada Rail Overseer in Fatal Derailment
